comments.commentBody: Walker's plan- let's let ALEC decide how to insure our constituents in the states. I live in Michigan where the Republicans are still arguing how to care for a city poisoned by lead..at their instruction. I don't believe they've proven themselves capable of handling healthcare.

All Mr. Walker and his puppet legislature are doing is making sure the Nationalist Republican Party has the final word on redistributing the free stuff to their own kind.  After all, isn't that intent of no taxes?

Stand strong while you give me the president's financial situation concerning Russia. Stand strong while you give me the solution to your complaints about Obamacare. Stand strong while you "fix" the economy for someone other than the bosses in companies protected by Citizens United and the Supreme Court.
Stand Strong, Republicans, and do the right thing by admitting you have used cheap labor again and again only to victimize, vilify and finally, construct laws and punishments for those that made and saved you billions.
Conservatives seem willing to forfeit their principles to make Trump happy. Why this one-sided courage against protesters?

Ok, Representative J. Denham, (R) CA-10th district, your turn.  You have the microphone.  What does the Republican healthcare plan say?  It's been 8 years.  Let your constituents have a peek at the draft.  Don't be a Democrat and sign a healthcare bill first and then read it later.  Eight years to work on it, surely the Republicans have a great bill ready for the President to sign.  Show Gov. Walker that those Republicans at the federal level have been working hard to have a healthcare bill ready.  You've got what?  Nothing?  Oh, you have something but it's not finished and we can't see it.  It will be made available for people to read it before Congress votes on it, right?  Let us see, read, review, discuss, debate and offer feedback?  Don't be a Democrat about it.  The bottom line is we want more comprehensive healthcare than what we have now at the same or better price, or the same healthcare that we have now, at a lower price than we are paying now.  If Congress can't do that then, people don't want it.
"Right to work" Ie anti-union States have lower wages, lower standards of living and more poverty.

Hey Gov. Walker just a reminder that 'liberal' Minnesota recovered sooner and stronger then Wisconsin after the self inflicted recession that was sponsored by your party. It's a pretty sad way to treat people - yes public employees are people too - by destroying their livelihoods to run up the points before an ill fated presidential run. Perhaps the Times should follow the money surrounding your political career after you sold off public goods to private entities. Oh and hey lest you forget Clinton did win the popular vote by a large margin. So go ahead and dismiss the protesters but be certain you do so at your own risk. Everything that goes around comes around.
Forget it. The Dems wil never get it. They abandoned FDR and JFK long before the Republicans embraced Russia.

The reason Wisconsin's employment rate has improved is due to President Obama's policies not Gov. Walker's.  President Obama brought the US economy back from the brink of disaster in 2008. Walker used the Wall St. & GOP manufactured world economic catastrophe to claim "we're broke" to use fear & resentment to divide Wiconsinites against each other for his own political power grab. In a rare truthful statement, President Trump during the debates said "Walker's State of Wisconsin is a mess!"  Actually Trump learned some dirty authoritarianism from the master Walker - disabling our Democracy with voter suppression & unconstitutional gerrymandering.  When Voter ID laws were passed, Walker grinned and stated "this one is obviously special".  There is nothing "special" in Walker's Wisconsin with African Americans representing 6% of the population, but 50% of the prison population.  Fix this injustice Governor, and while your at it fix your roads & highways.  Lastly have your supporters, your businesses take down some of the cluttering billboards on Hwy 41 - you can't even see Wisconsin's trees through the crap, especially outside of Sen Ron Johnson's Oshkosh & and Speaker Paul Ryan's Janesville.

[[Where do you want your dollar going? To your local school or to Washington? Caring for the needy in your community or to Washington? Their clear answer in 2016 was “not Washington.”]]

That is demonstrably false.

Trump's biggest promises - to "build that wall" and to step up deportations - are federal efforts that will require more money. Many of the people who voted for Trump did so based on those two promises, so those people voted to send their dollars to Washington to support those efforts.

Trump also promised to make the military "bigger and better" and the "best equipped." He's said he will do this by shifting money from other federal agencies, so while more tax dollars may not need to go to the federal government, many people voted to keep their money there and not have it returned to the states.

With regard to drug testing, here's a report that says that opiod addiction and deaths are up in Wisconsin. http://fox6now.com/2017/02/10/new-report-highlights-opioid-overdose-deat...

With regard to unions, one of the biggest barriers to people getting out of poverty is low wage employers keeping people under 40 hours a week and not giving them set schedules. McDonalds, Target and other low wage companies skim employee labor and pad their profits by not giving people health coverage or full time and overtime wages.

I see where you're coming from, but I don't buy your rhetoric.

Governor Walker -- You showed absolute contempt for the voters in your state. Accepting out of state money, you basically did everything you could to harm your own citizens, whether it was by destroying jobs and unions or education. You enacted the largest cuts to K-12 education in your state's history and only now are turning around this negative approach. You gutted the University of Wisconsin budget. Your plan to cut the minimum salary for construction workers is another strike at working class and middle class people. National job growth is higher than that of Wisconsin. You refused to accept expanded Medicaid to help the people of your state. You want to deny women and girls abortions even if they are the victims of rape, incest or need an abortion to save their lives.

I realize that you are running for a position with the Trump administration with this column or for reelection to a third term. Kind of pointless. Your approval level remains low, and Trump's approval level is no better.

Here's the thing - I'm not even reading this. Because I already know what he is trying to sell; state control to have patchy, uneven coverage. So they can then sue in federal court to shut it down altogether because its "unfair". Even though they are the ones who purposely put their fingers on the scale to make it so.

Yes, I hear the argument to give the other side a credible amount of time and space to argue their point.

However, the bottom line we've seen what Scot Walker has done to Wisconsin with other policies. He has not changes his tune. We've heard the audio tape from way back when we was pranked and showed he was the lackey of the Koch Brothers. We seen how he has decimated the last bastion of gaining solid middle class wages in this country - by undermining the unions.

I'm tired of trying to have a civil discourse with people who do not have my best interest at heart. Why do we even listen to him? He is not in any way, shape or form, trying to bolster the middle class.

Once again, he is slick talking and once again folks are falling for it. Go right ahead if you want to but please do not even gasp and clutch the pearls when he and his "ACA Reform" clique dismantle it brick by brick.
Thank you King George for your prescient analysis of how to deal with the unruly.  I'm certain it will, in the long run, be a winning strategy.

Yes, Unclebugs is right and Kansas is the perfect example of what NOT to do. Minnesota is actually doing far better than Wisconsin. We'll see what happens now in Iowa after the legislature voted to get rid of collective bargaining.
Curious then the Gov. Walker should accept so much money from out of state to beat his recall.

Let's extend Scott Walkers argument to the issue of clean air. California has, for good reason, the strictest tail pipe standards in the country. Despite what we want (yes, WE), Herr Trump intends to dismantle this so that Detroit can produce a few more pickup trucks and diesels using Union Labor! that will pollute more and cost slightly less. Based on his political tone, Walker would agree with Herr Trump even though my State will fight it for years. And Herr Trump will lose the fight anyway.

Walker lives in a bubble filled with Breitbart and Fox News. His only purpose is to allow the 1% to have a 50 foot yacht instead of a 45 foot yacht and to heck with the 99% rabble. He is UnAmerican. Should there be protestors outside his house? Absolutely.
Why is The Times giving op-ed space to this destructive, deluded, cruel person?

Dear Sharon, you are my twin. I am 56 and grew up in the Heights, currently in Tampa Florida, and also disturbed and distressed. You summarized my thoughts so completely and so eloquently. Thank you, Yours in Resistance, Julia
I wish I could recommend this 50 times.  You nailed it.
While the rest of us scribble right over his uneducated doodling.
what a simpleton
Can we drug test governors and state legislators as well?
Why give this troll more of a platform than he already has?
Just another bad haircut politician in bed with the big money guys.  When the Kochs say roll over, Scotty rolls over just like the little poodle that he is
He asks if your money should go to the states or to Washington?  If Republicans want to fund a $54B military hike and a wall, they better believe their money is going to Washington.
